intro: Schoenocaulon pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's star moss, is a rare and delicate plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists. Due to habitat loss and climate change, Schoenocaulon pringlei is considered endangered and requires protection.
